title: Context-Based Mathematical Word Problem-Solving Competency Development Course (K-12)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic operations and experience solving simple word problems
context.additional_context: A process of systematically analyzing word problem scenarios grounded in real-life contexts to develop logical thinking and problem-solving strategies.

learning_goals: One can identify core elements and mathematical relationships in given word problems with 90% accuracy
One can describe multi-step reasoning processes (three or more stages) for real-world contextual problems
Learners achieve over 80% success rates by selecting and applying appropriate strategies to various word problem types
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
